title: Avalon Marshes Walks

images.title: Simon Huguet / Shapwick Heath
images.caption: Shapwick Heath. Looking from Noah's hide across towards Roughet. Shapwick Heath is a National Nature Reserve based around former peat workings. The open water and reedbeds support a wide range of birds and other wildlife.

images.title: Ken Grainger / The Glastonbury Canal and Meare Heath
images.caption: The Glastonbury Canal and Meare Heath

images.title: Simon Huguet / Meare Heath
images.caption: Looking across Meare Heath from the hide. Meare Heath is part of the Shapwick Heath National Nature Reserve in the Avalon Marshes. The reserve is managed by Natural England and is important for its fenland, wet meadows, reedbeds and wet woodland and the large areas of open water formed by restored peat workings.

images.title: Simon Huguet / Birch coppice, Meare Heath
images.caption: Birch coppice, Meare Heath. One of the woodland areas on Shapwick Heath National Nature Reserve in the Avalon Marshes.

images.title: Simon Huguet / Shapwick Heath
images.caption: Shapwick Heath. Taken from the bridge to Meare Heath looking along the main rhyne and the former peat railway towards Ashcott Corner and Ham Wall.

images.title: Mary and Angus Hogg / Ham Wall Viewpoint
images.caption: Ham Wall Viewpoint. The RSPB's Ham Wall reserve has lots of good vantage points overlooking the marsh.

images.title: Hugh Venables / Avalon Hide, Ham Wall RSPB
images.caption: Avalon Hide, Ham Wall RSPB. Giving a good elevated view over part of the reedbed.

images.title: Ken Grainger / Archway, Westhay Moor Nature Reserve
images.caption: Archway, Westhay Moor Nature Reserve

description: The Avalon Marshes is an expansive nature reserve set in the Somerset's Levels. It's a wonderful place for bird watching with thousands of birds to look out for from a number of hides dotted around the site. These include heron, bittern, great white egrets, garganeys, marsh harriers, hobbies, bearded tits and Cetti's, reed and sedge warblers. The area is great for walkers with miles of easy flat footpaths taking you around the reserve's lakes and waterways. In the reserve you will find a series of smaller reserves including:
